result.execSummary:
The defendant Malcolm Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence.
Pay a fine of $100.00 including all applicable costs and surcharges to be paid by 8/10/15.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malcolm Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malcolm Davis in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
ON COURT'S OWN MOTION, THE PENALTY ENHANCER, DOMESTIC ABUSE IS DISMISSED.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $100.00  including all applicable costs and surcharges to be paid by 8/10/15.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Malcolm Davis in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the state, Court ordered the complaint amended to correct the address where the incident took place.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Malcolm Davis in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 4/15/15 in Branch 40.  State needs to get a copy of the 911 call to the defense.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Malcolm Davis in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING BREATHALYZER TESTS AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANDREA H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Malcolm Davis in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Malcolm Davis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Malcolm Davis
Current: 2152 N 28TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 01-11-2015)
Prior: 2732 North 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
